data.title: Fixes crash while invoking pause&resume right after play2d.
Fixed Camera::_viewProjectionUpdated state
data.body:
Camera::_viewProjectionUpdated is not initialised in constructor. Should be initialised to false.
This can lead to redundant visibility checks if _viewProjectionUpdated happens to resolve true.

As Camera::visit() is never called, _viewProjectionUpdated is never actually updated, resulting in no visibility tests when the camera transform changes.

Fixes #16404

data.title: Camera::_viewProjectionUpdated not initialised
data.body:
cocos2d-x version: 3.12

Camera::_viewProjectionUpdated is not initialised in constructor. Should be initialised to false.
This can lead to redundant visibility checks if _viewProjectionUpdated happens to resolve true.

Furthermore as Camera::visit() is never called, _viewProjectionUpdated is never actually updated, resulting in no visibility tests when the camera transform changes.

I propose we add 
`_viewProjectionUpdated = _transformUpdated;`
to Camera::apply() as well.

data.title: Remove unnecessary ActionInterval casts
data.body: This PR removes several unnecessary casts (from Sequence to ActionInterval) and changes some of the type declarations to `auto` keywords. Thanks!

data.title: The order of function calls in ProtectedNode::onEnter method
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: Quick-3.3
- devices test on: Windows 8.1
- developing environments
  - NDK version: r10c
  - VS version: VS2013

Class ProtectedNode has this method: onEnter.
In this method, why Node::onEnter called before iterate _protectedChildren?
This order is different from Node::onEnter method.
In onEnterTransitionDidFinish, onExitTransitionDidStart, onExit also have this problem.

Can i reverse the order in ProtectedNode::onEnter?
Help me, thank you!

data.title: Fixing issue where the JS global object would not be finalized when c…
data.body:
…alling __restartVM(), due to an issue where PersistentRootedObject were not being properly cleaned up.

This is being provided as a point of reference for issue https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/16327 . You may choose to iterate on this more, or go a different route to fix it. I figured it would be easier for your team if we shared the code we used to work around this issue. 

I created a new class definition to facilitate the removal of the mozilla::Maybe objects. A lot of generated and non-generated code was using the .ref() interface, and it was easier to create a class that shared an interface then change all of the code that used this interface.

data.title: Missing closure-compiler jar file
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: cocos2d-x-3.13
- developing environment: linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install cocos2d-x (clone, clone submodules, `./setup.py`, `exec bash`)
2. Create new JS project: `cocos new -l js test`
   3: `cd test`
3. Try to compile it: `cocos compile -p web -m release`

Result:

```
Buildfile: /tmp/test/publish/html5/build.xml

BUILD FAILED
/tmp/test/publish/html5/build.xml:5: taskdef class com.google.javascript.jscomp.ant.CompileTask cannot be found
 using the classloader AntClassLoader[]

Total time: 0 seconds
Error running command, return code: 1.
```

Looking at `build.xml` I can find this line:

```
    <taskdef name="jscomp" classname="com.google.javascript.jscomp.ant.CompileTask"
             classpath="/home/ntrrgc/Programas/cocos2d-x/tools/cocos2d-console/plugins/plugin_compile/build_web/bin/compiler-1.7.jar"/>
```

It fails because `tools/cocos2d-console/plugins/plugin_compile/build_web/bin/compiler-1.7.jar` does not exist in the cocos2d-x directory (the `build_web/bin` directory does not exist at all). 

I guess that file is the closure compiler, which should be automatically downloaded at some point. Am I missing something?
